H0.text: Heredity is what Gregor Mendel contributed to the study of biology by the careful, objective study of.

H1.text: Bacteria are the subject of Gregor Mendelâ€™s careful, objective study that contributed to the study of biology.

H2.text: Pedigrees were the focus of Gregor Mendel's careful, objective study that contributed to the study of biology.

H3.text: Environment was the focus of Gregor Mendel's careful, objective study that contributed to the study of biology.

A4.text: Mendel's pea plant experiments conducted between 1856 and 1863 established many of the rules of heredity, now referred to as the laws of Mendelian inheritance.

A5.text: Mendel worked with seven characteristics of pea plants: plant height, pod shape and color, seed shape and color, and flower position and color.
